090/**
091 * An ApplicationMaster for executing shell commands on a set of launched
092 * containers using the YARN framework.
093 * 
094 * <p>
095 * This class is meant to act as an example on how to write yarn-based
096 * application masters.
097 * </p>
098 * 
099 * <p>
100 * The ApplicationMaster is started on a container by the
101 * <code>ResourceManager</code>'s launcher. The first thing that the
102 * <code>ApplicationMaster</code> needs to do is to connect and register itself
103 * with the <code>ResourceManager</code>. The registration sets up information
104 * within the <code>ResourceManager</code> regarding what host:port the
105 * ApplicationMaster is listening on to provide any form of functionality to a
106 * client as well as a tracking url that a client can use to keep track of
107 * status/job history if needed. However, in the distributedshell, trackingurl
108 * and appMasterHost:appMasterRpcPort are not supported.
109 * </p>
110 * 
111 * <p>
112 * The <code>ApplicationMaster</code> needs to send a heartbeat to the
113 * <code>ResourceManager</code> at regular intervals to inform the
114 * <code>ResourceManager</code> that it is up and alive. The
115 * {@link ApplicationMasterProtocol#allocate} to the <code>ResourceManager</code> from the
116 * <code>ApplicationMaster</code> acts as a heartbeat.
117 * 
118 * <p>
119 * For the actual handling of the job, the <code>ApplicationMaster</code> has to
120 * request the <code>ResourceManager</code> via {@link AllocateRequest} for the
121 * required no. of containers using {@link ResourceRequest} with the necessary
122 * resource specifications such as node location, computational
123 * (memory/disk/cpu) resource requirements. The <code>ResourceManager</code>
124 * responds with an {@link AllocateResponse} that informs the
125 * <code>ApplicationMaster</code> of the set of newly allocated containers,
126 * completed containers as well as current state of available resources.
127 * </p>
128 * 
129 * <p>
130 * For each allocated container, the <code>ApplicationMaster</code> can then set
131 * up the necessary launch context via {@link ContainerLaunchContext} to specify
132 * the allocated container id, local resources required by the executable, the
133 * environment to be setup for the executable, commands to execute, etc. and
134 * submit a {@link StartContainerRequest} to the {@link ContainerManagementProtocol} to
135 * launch and execute the defined commands on the given allocated container.
136 * </p>
137 * 
138 * <p>
139 * The <code>ApplicationMaster</code> can monitor the launched container by
140 * either querying the <code>ResourceManager</code> using
141 * {@link ApplicationMasterProtocol#allocate} to get updates on completed containers or via
142 * the {@link ContainerManagementProtocol} by querying for the status of the allocated
143 * container's {@link ContainerId}.
144 *
145 * <p>
146 * After the job has been completed, the <code>ApplicationMaster</code> has to
147 * send a {@link FinishApplicationMasterRequest} to the
148 * <code>ResourceManager</code> to inform it that the
149 * <code>ApplicationMaster</code> has been completed.
150 */
151@InterfaceAudience.Public
152@InterfaceStability.Unstable
153public class ApplicationMaster {
154

187  private int containerVirtualCores = 1;

201  private AtomicInteger numRequestedContainers = new AtomicInteger();

212  private String shellScriptPath = "";
213  // Timestamp needed for creating a local resource

215  // File length needed for local resource

229  /**
230   * @param args Command line args
231   */
232  public static void main(String[] args) {
233    boolean result = false;
234    try {
235      ApplicationMaster appMaster = new ApplicationMaster();
236      LOG.info("Initializing ApplicationMaster");
237      boolean doRun = appMaster.init(args);
238      if (!doRun) {
239        System.exit(0);
240      }
241      result = appMaster.run();
242    } catch (Throwable t) {
243      LOG.fatal("Error running ApplicationMaster", t);
244      System.exit(1);
245    }
246    if (result) {
247      LOG.info("Application Master completed successfully. exiting");
248      System.exit(0);
249    } else {
250      LOG.info("Application Master failed. exiting");
251      System.exit(2);
252    }
253  }
254
255  /**
256   * Dump out contents of $CWD and the environment to stdout for debugging
257   */
258  private void dumpOutDebugInfo() {
259
260    LOG.info("Dump debug output");
261    Map<String, String> envs = System.getenv();
262    for (Map.Entry<String, String> env : envs.entrySet()) {
263      LOG.info("System env: key=" + env.getKey() + ", val=" + env.getValue());
264      System.out.println("System env: key=" + env.getKey() + ", val="
265          + env.getValue());
266    }
267
268    BufferedReader buf = null;
269    try {
270      String lines = Shell.WINDOWS ? Shell.execCommand("cmd", "/c", "dir") :
271        Shell.execCommand("ls", "-al");
272      buf = new BufferedReader(new StringReader(lines));
273      String line = "";
274      while ((line = buf.readLine()) != null) {
275        LOG.info("System CWD content: " + line);
276        System.out.println("System CWD content: " + line);
277      }
278    } catch (IOException e) {
279      e.printStackTrace();
280    } finally {
281      IOUtils.cleanup(LOG, buf);
282    }
283  }

285  public ApplicationMaster() {
286    // Set up the configuration
287    conf = new YarnConfiguration();
288  }
289
290  /**
291   * Parse command line options
292   *
293   * @param args Command line args
294   * @return Whether init successful and run should be invoked
295   * @throws ParseException
296   * @throws IOException
297   */
298  public boolean init(String[] args) throws ParseException, IOException {
299
300    Options opts = new Options();
301    opts.addOption("app_attempt_id", true,
302        "App Attempt ID. Not to be used unless for testing purposes");
303    opts.addOption("shell_command", true,
304        "Shell command to be executed by the Application Master");
305    opts.addOption("shell_script", true,
306        "Location of the shell script to be executed");
307    opts.addOption("shell_args", true, "Command line args for the shell script");
308    opts.addOption("shell_env", true,
309        "Environment for shell script. Specified as env_key=env_val pairs");
310    opts.addOption("container_memory", true,
311        "Amount of memory in MB to be requested to run the shell command");
312    opts.addOption("container_vcores", true,
313        "Amount of virtual cores to be requested to run the shell command");
314    opts.addOption("num_containers", true,
315        "No. of containers on which the shell command needs to be executed");
316    opts.addOption("priority", true, "Application Priority. Default 0");
317    opts.addOption("debug", false, "Dump out debug information");
318
319    opts.addOption("help", false, "Print usage");
320    CommandLine cliParser = new GnuParser().parse(opts, args);
321
322    if (args.length == 0) {
323      printUsage(opts);
324      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
325          "No args specified for application master to initialize");
326    }
327
328    if (cliParser.hasOption("help")) {
329      printUsage(opts);
330      return false;
331    }
332
333    if (cliParser.hasOption("debug")) {
334      dumpOutDebugInfo();
335    }
336
337    Map<String, String> envs = System.getenv();
338
339    if (!envs.containsKey(Environment.CONTAINER_ID.name())) {
340      if (cliParser.hasOption("app_attempt_id")) {
341        String appIdStr = cliParser.getOptionValue("app_attempt_id", "");
342        appAttemptID = ConverterUtils.toApplicationAttemptId(appIdStr);
343      } else {
344        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
345            "Application Attempt Id not set in the environment");
346      }
347    } else {
348      ContainerId containerId = ConverterUtils.toContainerId(envs
349          .get(Environment.CONTAINER_ID.name()));
350      appAttemptID = containerId.getApplicationAttemptId();
351    }
352
353    if (!envs.containsKey(ApplicationConstants.APP_SUBMIT_TIME_ENV)) {
354      throw new RuntimeException(ApplicationConstants.APP_SUBMIT_TIME_ENV
355          + " not set in the environment");
356    }
357    if (!envs.containsKey(Environment.NM_HOST.name())) {
358      throw new RuntimeException(Environment.NM_HOST.name()
359          + " not set in the environment");
360    }
361    if (!envs.containsKey(Environment.NM_HTTP_PORT.name())) {
362      throw new RuntimeException(Environment.NM_HTTP_PORT
363          + " not set in the environment");
364    }
365    if (!envs.containsKey(Environment.NM_PORT.name())) {
366      throw new RuntimeException(Environment.NM_PORT.name()
367          + " not set in the environment");
368    }
369
370    LOG.info("Application master for app" + ", appId="
371        + appAttemptID.getApplicationId().getId() + ", clustertimestamp="
372        + appAttemptID.getApplicationId().getClusterTimestamp()
373        + ", attemptId=" + appAttemptID.getAttemptId());
374
375    if (!cliParser.hasOption("shell_command")) {
376      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
377          "No shell command specified to be executed by application master");
378    }
379    shellCommand = cliParser.getOptionValue("shell_command");
380
381    if (cliParser.hasOption("shell_args")) {
382      shellArgs = cliParser.getOptionValue("shell_args");
383    }
384    if (cliParser.hasOption("shell_env")) {
385      String shellEnvs[] = cliParser.getOptionValues("shell_env");
386      for (String env : shellEnvs) {
387        env = env.trim();
388        int index = env.indexOf('=');
389        if (index == -1) {
390          shellEnv.put(env, "");
391          continue;
392        }
393        String key = env.substring(0, index);
394        String val = "";
395        if (index < (env.length() - 1)) {
396          val = env.substring(index + 1);
397        }
398        shellEnv.put(key, val);
399      }
400    }
401
402    if (envs.containsKey(DSConstants.DISTRIBUTEDSHELLSCRIPTLOCATION)) {
403      shellScriptPath = envs.get(DSConstants.DISTRIBUTEDSHELLSCRIPTLOCATION);
404
405      if (envs.containsKey(DSConstants.DISTRIBUTEDSHELLSCRIPTTIMESTAMP)) {
406        shellScriptPathTimestamp = Long.valueOf(envs
407            .get(DSConstants.DISTRIBUTEDSHELLSCRIPTTIMESTAMP));
408      }
409      if (envs.containsKey(DSConstants.DISTRIBUTEDSHELLSCRIPTLEN)) {
410        shellScriptPathLen = Long.valueOf(envs
411            .get(DSConstants.DISTRIBUTEDSHELLSCRIPTLEN));
412      }
413
414      if (!shellScriptPath.isEmpty()
415          && (shellScriptPathTimestamp <= 0 || shellScriptPathLen <= 0)) {
416        LOG.error("Illegal values in env for shell script path" + ", path="
417            + shellScriptPath + ", len=" + shellScriptPathLen + ", timestamp="
418            + shellScriptPathTimestamp);
419        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
420            "Illegal values in env for shell script path");
421      }
422    }
423
424    containerMemory = Integer.parseInt(cliParser.getOptionValue(
425        "container_memory", "10"));
426    containerVirtualCores = Integer.parseInt(cliParser.getOptionValue(
427        "container_vcores", "1"));
428    numTotalContainers = Integer.parseInt(cliParser.getOptionValue(
429        "num_containers", "1"));
430    if (numTotalContainers == 0) {
431      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
432          "Cannot run distributed shell with no containers");
433    }
434    requestPriority = Integer.parseInt(cliParser
435        .getOptionValue("priority", "0"));
436
437    return true;
438  }

449  /**
450   * Main run function for the application master
451   *
452   * @throws YarnException
453   * @throws IOException
454   */
455  @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked" })
456  public boolean run() throws YarnException, IOException {
457    LOG.info("Starting ApplicationMaster");
458
459    Credentials credentials =
460        UserGroupInformation.getCurrentUser().getCredentials();
461    DataOutputBuffer dob = new DataOutputBuffer();
462    credentials.writeTokenStorageToStream(dob);
463    // Now remove the AM->RM token so that containers cannot access it.
464    Iterator<Token<?>> iter = credentials.getAllTokens().iterator();
465    while (iter.hasNext()) {
466      Token<?> token = iter.next();
467      if (token.getKind().equals(AMRMTokenIdentifier.KIND_NAME)) {
468        iter.remove();
469      }
470    }
471    allTokens = ByteBuffer.wrap(dob.getData(), 0, dob.getLength());
472
473    AMRMClientAsync.CallbackHandler allocListener = new RMCallbackHandler();
474    amRMClient = AMRMClientAsync.createAMRMClientAsync(1000, allocListener);
475    amRMClient.init(conf);
476    amRMClient.start();
477
478    containerListener = createNMCallbackHandler();
479    nmClientAsync = new NMClientAsyncImpl(containerListener);
480    nmClientAsync.init(conf);
481    nmClientAsync.start();
482
483    // Setup local RPC Server to accept status requests directly from clients
484    // TODO need to setup a protocol for client to be able to communicate to
485    // the RPC server
486    // TODO use the rpc port info to register with the RM for the client to
487    // send requests to this app master
488
489    // Register self with ResourceManager
490    // This will start heartbeating to the RM
491    appMasterHostname = NetUtils.getHostname();
492    RegisterApplicationMasterResponse response = amRMClient
493        .registerApplicationMaster(appMasterHostname, appMasterRpcPort,
494            appMasterTrackingUrl);
495    // Dump out information about cluster capability as seen by the
496    // resource manager
497    int maxMem = response.getMaximumResourceCapability().getMemory();
498    LOG.info("Max mem capabililty of resources in this cluster " + maxMem);
499    
500    int maxVCores = response.getMaximumResourceCapability().getVirtualCores();
501    LOG.info("Max vcores capabililty of resources in this cluster " + maxVCores);
502
503    // A resource ask cannot exceed the max.
504    if (containerMemory > maxMem) {
505      LOG.info("Container memory specified above max threshold of cluster."
506          + " Using max value." + ", specified=" + containerMemory + ", max="
507          + maxMem);
508      containerMemory = maxMem;
509    }
510
511    if (containerVirtualCores > maxVCores) {
512      LOG.info("Container virtual cores specified above max threshold of cluster."
513          + " Using max value." + ", specified=" + containerVirtualCores + ", max="
514          + maxVCores);
515      containerVirtualCores = maxVCores;
516    }
517
518    // Setup ask for containers from RM
519    // Send request for containers to RM
520    // Until we get our fully allocated quota, we keep on polling RM for
521    // containers
522    // Keep looping until all the containers are launched and shell script
523    // executed on them ( regardless of success/failure).
524    for (int i = 0; i < numTotalContainers; ++i) {
525      ContainerRequest containerAsk = setupContainerAskForRM();
526      amRMClient.addContainerRequest(containerAsk);
527    }
528    numRequestedContainers.set(numTotalContainers);
529
530    while (!done
531        && (numCompletedContainers.get() != numTotalContainers)) {
532      try {
533        Thread.sleep(200);
534      } catch (InterruptedException ex) {}
535    }
536    finish();
537    
538    return success;
539  }
540
541  @VisibleForTesting
542  NMCallbackHandler createNMCallbackHandler() {
543    return new NMCallbackHandler(this);
544  }
545
546  private void finish() {
547    // Join all launched threads
548    // needed for when we time out
549    // and we need to release containers
550    for (Thread launchThread : launchThreads) {
551      try {
552        launchThread.join(10000);
553      } catch (InterruptedException e) {
554        LOG.info("Exception thrown in thread join: " + e.getMessage());
555        e.printStackTrace();
556      }
557    }
558
559    // When the application completes, it should stop all running containers
560    LOG.info("Application completed. Stopping running containers");
561    nmClientAsync.stop();
562
563    // When the application completes, it should send a finish application
564    // signal to the RM
565    LOG.info("Application completed. Signalling finish to RM");
566
567    FinalApplicationStatus appStatus;
568    String appMessage = null;
569    success = true;
570    if (numFailedContainers.get() == 0 && 
571        numCompletedContainers.get() == numTotalContainers) {
572      appStatus = FinalApplicationStatus.SUCCEEDED;
573    } else {
574      appStatus = FinalApplicationStatus.FAILED;
575      appMessage = "Diagnostics." + ", total=" + numTotalContainers
576          + ", completed=" + numCompletedContainers.get() + ", allocated="
577          + numAllocatedContainers.get() + ", failed="
578          + numFailedContainers.get();
579      success = false;
580    }
581    try {
582      amRMClient.unregisterApplicationMaster(appStatus, appMessage, null);
583    } catch (YarnException ex) {
584      LOG.error("Failed to unregister application", ex);
585    } catch (IOException e) {
586      LOG.error("Failed to unregister application", e);
587    }
588    
589    amRMClient.stop();
590  }
591  
592  private class RMCallbackHandler implements AMRMClientAsync.CallbackHandler {
593    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
594    @Override
595    public void onContainersCompleted(List<ContainerStatus> completedContainers) {
596      LOG.info("Got response from RM for container ask, completedCnt="
597          + completedContainers.size());
598      for (ContainerStatus containerStatus : completedContainers) {
599        LOG.info("Got container status for containerID="
600            + containerStatus.getContainerId() + ", state="
601            + containerStatus.getState() + ", exitStatus="
602            + containerStatus.getExitStatus() + ", diagnostics="
603            + containerStatus.getDiagnostics());
604
605        // non complete containers should not be here
606        assert (containerStatus.getState() == ContainerState.COMPLETE);
607
608        // increment counters for completed/failed containers
609        int exitStatus = containerStatus.getExitStatus();
610        if (0 != exitStatus) {
611          // container failed
612          if (ContainerExitStatus.ABORTED != exitStatus) {
613            // shell script failed
614            // counts as completed
615            numCompletedContainers.incrementAndGet();
616            numFailedContainers.incrementAndGet();
617          } else {
618            // container was killed by framework, possibly preempted
619            // we should re-try as the container was lost for some reason
620            numAllocatedContainers.decrementAndGet();
621            numRequestedContainers.decrementAndGet();
622            // we do not need to release the container as it would be done
623            // by the RM
624          }
625        } else {
626          // nothing to do
627          // container completed successfully
628          numCompletedContainers.incrementAndGet();
629          LOG.info("Container completed successfully." + ", containerId="
630              + containerStatus.getContainerId());
631        }
632      }
633      
634      // ask for more containers if any failed
635      int askCount = numTotalContainers - numRequestedContainers.get();
636      numRequestedContainers.addAndGet(askCount);
637
638      if (askCount > 0) {
639        for (int i = 0; i < askCount; ++i) {
640          ContainerRequest containerAsk = setupContainerAskForRM();
641          amRMClient.addContainerRequest(containerAsk);
642        }
643      }
644      
645      if (numCompletedContainers.get() == numTotalContainers) {
646        done = true;
647      }
648    }
649
650    @Override
651    public void onContainersAllocated(List<Container> allocatedContainers) {
652      LOG.info("Got response from RM for container ask, allocatedCnt="
653          + allocatedContainers.size());
654      numAllocatedContainers.addAndGet(allocatedContainers.size());
655      for (Container allocatedContainer : allocatedContainers) {
656        LOG.info("Launching shell command on a new container."
657            + ", containerId=" + allocatedContainer.getId()
658            + ", containerNode=" + allocatedContainer.getNodeId().getHost()
659            + ":" + allocatedContainer.getNodeId().getPort()
660            + ", containerNodeURI=" + allocatedContainer.getNodeHttpAddress()
661            + ", containerResourceMemory"
662            + allocatedContainer.getResource().getMemory()
663            + ", containerResourceVirtualCores"
664            + allocatedContainer.getResource().getVirtualCores());
665        // + ", containerToken"
666        // +allocatedContainer.getContainerToken().getIdentifier().toString());
667
668        LaunchContainerRunnable runnableLaunchContainer =
669            new LaunchContainerRunnable(allocatedContainer, containerListener);
670        Thread launchThread = new Thread(runnableLaunchContainer);
671
672        // launch and start the container on a separate thread to keep
673        // the main thread unblocked
674        // as all containers may not be allocated at one go.
675        launchThreads.add(launchThread);
676        launchThread.start();
677      }
678    }
679
680    @Override
681    public void onShutdownRequest() {
682      done = true;
683    }
684
685    @Override
686    public void onNodesUpdated(List<NodeReport> updatedNodes) {}
687
688    @Override
689    public float getProgress() {
690      // set progress to deliver to RM on next heartbeat
691      float progress = (float) numCompletedContainers.get()
692          / numTotalContainers;
693      return progress;
694    }
695
696    @Override
697    public void onError(Throwable e) {
698      done = true;
699      amRMClient.stop();
700    }
701  }
702
703  @VisibleForTesting
704  static class NMCallbackHandler
705    implements NMClientAsync.CallbackHandler {
706
707    private ConcurrentMap<ContainerId, Container> containers =
708        new ConcurrentHashMap<ContainerId, Container>();
709    private final ApplicationMaster applicationMaster;
710
711    public NMCallbackHandler(ApplicationMaster applicationMaster) {
712      this.applicationMaster = applicationMaster;
713    }
714
715    public void addContainer(ContainerId containerId, Container container) {
716      containers.putIfAbsent(containerId, container);
717    }
718
719    @Override
720    public void onContainerStopped(ContainerId containerId) {
721      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
722        LOG.debug("Succeeded to stop Container " + containerId);
723      }
724      containers.remove(containerId);
725    }
726
727    @Override
728    public void onContainerStatusReceived(ContainerId containerId,
729        ContainerStatus containerStatus) {
730      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
731        LOG.debug("Container Status: id=" + containerId + ", status=" +
732            containerStatus);
733      }
734    }
735
736    @Override
737    public void onContainerStarted(ContainerId containerId,
738        Map<String, ByteBuffer> allServiceResponse) {
739      if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
740        LOG.debug("Succeeded to start Container " + containerId);
741      }
742      Container container = containers.get(containerId);
743      if (container != null) {
744        applicationMaster.nmClientAsync.getContainerStatusAsync(containerId, container.getNodeId());
745      }
746    }
747
748    @Override
749    public void onStartContainerError(ContainerId containerId, Throwable t) {
750      LOG.error("Failed to start Container " + containerId);
751      containers.remove(containerId);
752      applicationMaster.numCompletedContainers.incrementAndGet();
753      applicationMaster.numFailedContainers.incrementAndGet();
754    }
755
756    @Override
757    public void onGetContainerStatusError(
758        ContainerId containerId, Throwable t) {
759      LOG.error("Failed to query the status of Container " + containerId);
760    }
761
762    @Override
763    public void onStopContainerError(ContainerId containerId, Throwable t) {
764      LOG.error("Failed to stop Container " + containerId);
765      containers.remove(containerId);
766    }
767  }
768
769  /**
770   * Thread to connect to the {@link ContainerManagementProtocol} and launch the container
771   * that will execute the shell command.
772   */
773  private class LaunchContainerRunnable implements Runnable {
774
775    // Allocated container
776    Container container;
777
778    NMCallbackHandler containerListener;
779
780    /**
781     * @param lcontainer Allocated container
782     * @param containerListener Callback handler of the container
783     */
784    public LaunchContainerRunnable(
785        Container lcontainer, NMCallbackHandler containerListener) {
786      this.container = lcontainer;
787      this.containerListener = containerListener;
788    }
789
790    @Override
791    /**
792     * Connects to CM, sets up container launch context 
793     * for shell command and eventually dispatches the container 
794     * start request to the CM. 
795     */
796    public void run() {
797      LOG.info("Setting up container launch container for containerid="
798          + container.getId());
799      ContainerLaunchContext ctx = Records
800          .newRecord(ContainerLaunchContext.class);
801
802      // Set the environment
803      ctx.setEnvironment(shellEnv);
804
805      // Set the local resources
806      Map<String, LocalResource> localResources = new HashMap<String, LocalResource>();
807
808      // The container for the eventual shell commands needs its own local
809      // resources too.
810      // In this scenario, if a shell script is specified, we need to have it
811      // copied and made available to the container.
812      if (!shellScriptPath.isEmpty()) {
813        LocalResource shellRsrc = Records.newRecord(LocalResource.class);
814        shellRsrc.setType(LocalResourceType.FILE);
815        shellRsrc.setVisibility(LocalResourceVisibility.APPLICATION);
816        try {
817          shellRsrc.setResource(ConverterUtils.getYarnUrlFromURI(new URI(
818              shellScriptPath)));
819        } catch (URISyntaxException e) {
820          LOG.error("Error when trying to use shell script path specified"
821              + " in env, path=" + shellScriptPath);
822          e.printStackTrace();
823
824          // A failure scenario on bad input such as invalid shell script path
825          // We know we cannot continue launching the container
826          // so we should release it.
827          // TODO
828          numCompletedContainers.incrementAndGet();
829          numFailedContainers.incrementAndGet();
830          return;
831        }
832        shellRsrc.setTimestamp(shellScriptPathTimestamp);
833        shellRsrc.setSize(shellScriptPathLen);
834        localResources.put(ExecShellStringPath, shellRsrc);
835      }
836      ctx.setLocalResources(localResources);
837
838      // Set the necessary command to execute on the allocated container
839      Vector<CharSequence> vargs = new Vector<CharSequence>(5);
840
841      // Set executable command
842      vargs.add(shellCommand);
843      // Set shell script path
844      if (!shellScriptPath.isEmpty()) {
845        vargs.add(ExecShellStringPath);
846      }
847
848      // Set args for the shell command if any
849      vargs.add(shellArgs);
850      // Add log redirect params
851      vargs.add("1>" + ApplicationConstants.LOG_DIR_EXPANSION_VAR + "/stdout");
852      vargs.add("2>" + ApplicationConstants.LOG_DIR_EXPANSION_VAR + "/stderr");
853
854      // Get final commmand
855      StringBuilder command = new StringBuilder();
856      for (CharSequence str : vargs) {
857        command.append(str).append(" ");
858      }
859
860      List<String> commands = new ArrayList<String>();
861      commands.add(command.toString());
862      ctx.setCommands(commands);
863
864      // Set up tokens for the container too. Today, for normal shell commands,
865      // the container in distribute-shell doesn't need any tokens. We are
866      // populating them mainly for NodeManagers to be able to download any
867      // files in the distributed file-system. The tokens are otherwise also
868      // useful in cases, for e.g., when one is running a "hadoop dfs" command
869      // inside the distributed shell.
870      ctx.setTokens(allTokens.duplicate());
871
872      containerListener.addContainer(container.getId(), container);
873      nmClientAsync.startContainerAsync(container, ctx);
874    }
875  }
876
877  /**
878   * Setup the request that will be sent to the RM for the container ask.
879   *
880   * @return the setup ResourceRequest to be sent to RM
881   */
882  private ContainerRequest setupContainerAskForRM() {
883    // setup requirements for hosts
884    // using * as any host will do for the distributed shell app
885    // set the priority for the request
886    Priority pri = Records.newRecord(Priority.class);
887    // TODO - what is the range for priority? how to decide?
888    pri.setPriority(requestPriority);
889
890    // Set up resource type requirements
891    // For now, memory and CPU are supported so we set memory and cpu requirements
892    Resource capability = Records.newRecord(Resource.class);
893    capability.setMemory(containerMemory);
894    capability.setVirtualCores(containerVirtualCores);
895
896    ContainerRequest request = new ContainerRequest(capability, null, null,
897        pri);
898    LOG.info("Requested container ask: " + request.toString());
899    return request;
900  }
